string.name: textformat1
string.br: Before your blood donation:\n
\n
1.Get plenty of sleep the night before you plan to donate.\n
2.Eat a healthy meal before your donation.\n
3.Drink plenty of water before the donation.\n
4.Check to see if any medications you are taking or recently took would prevent you from donating.\n
5.Wear a shirt with sleeves that can be rolled up.\n
\n

string.name: textformat2
string.br: After your blood donation:\n
\n
1.Avoid strenuous physical activity or heavy lifting for about five hours.\n
2.If you feel lightheaded, lie down with your feet up until the feeling passes.\n
3.Keep your bandage on and dry for the next five hours.\n
4.If you have bleeding after removing the bandage, put pressure on the site and raise your arm until the bleeding stops.\n
5.If bruising occurs, apply a cold pack to the area periodically during the first 24 hours.\n
6.Consider adding iron-rich foods to your diet to replace the iron lost with blood donation.\n
\n
Contact the blood donor center or your doctor if you:\n
1.Forgot to report any important health information.\n
2.Have signs and symptoms of an illness, such as a fever, within several days after your blood donation.\n
3.Are diagnosed with COVID-19 within 48 hours after donating blood.\n
